title: Relative Constructibility via Restricted Abstract State Machines
abstract:
We restrict the computational power of Gurevich's abstract state machines to
obtain two classes of machine models for generalised computation of sets,
namely restricted abstract state machines (RASMs) and restricted abstract state
machines with parameters (RASMPs). We derive from each class, a relative
computability relation on sets, which is analogous to the Turing reducibility
relation on reals. We then prove that the relative computability relation
derived from RASMPs is equivalent to relative constructibility.
